document.docTitle: Orchamus yersini subsp. davisi Uvarov 1949, stat. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Pamphagidae (Orthoptera: Acridoidea) from the Palaearctic Region: taxonomy, classification, keys to genera and a review of the tribe Nocarodeini I. Bolívar

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Pamphagidae (Orthoptera: Acridoidea) from the Palaearctic Region: taxonomy, classification, keys to genera and a review of the tribe Nocarodeini I. Bolívar

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Orchamus yersini
( Br . v. W.):
Ramme 1951 : 412
, partim (Samos).

Orchamus davisi Uvarov, 1949
:
Karabağ 1958 : 125
, partim;
Otte 1994 : 177
;
Sevgili et al. 2011
: 644
;

: 139
.

Type locality
. Turkey , Antalya , Termessos.
Holotype :
female ( NHMUK ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. TURKEY : SW Turkey , nr
.
Antalya , Termessus ,
1000 m
,
12.8.1947
, 1♀ ( Holotype ) (leg. P. H. Davis ); SW Turkey
,
Denizli vilayet [ Antalya ], between Antalya and Korkudeli ,
16.8.1947
, 2♂ ( Paratypes ) (leg. P. H. Davis )
;
Antalya , Kemer , Görnük ,
30 m
,
17.7.1949
, 1♂ (leg. T. Karabağ ) (det. as
Orchamus davisi
)
;
Antalya , Termessus ,
100–600 m
,
19.7.1949
, 1♂ ( Topotype ) (leg. T. Karabağ ) (det. as
Orchamus davisi
)
;
Muğla , Agla ,
25.5.1947
, 1♀ (det. as
Orchamus davisi
) (all in NHMUK )
;
Muğla , Datça kuzeyi,
120 m
,
20.5.2001
, 1♂ (leg. A. Hasbenli ) ( MAZM )
;
Denizli , Beyağaç , Topuklu Yaylası ,
1373 m
, 37.07.868 N, 28.51.380 E,
10.6.2011
, 1♀ (leg. M. Ünal ) (AİBÜEM); Makri [ Fethiye , Muğla ], 1♂ , nr. 8231, (leg. D. Krüper ) (det. Ramme as
Orchamus davisi Uv.
?) (det. Massa as
Orchamus davisi
, but published as
O. yersini in Massa, 2009
); Kl. Asien , [ Antalya ], Güllik Dagh [ Güllük Dağı ], 1♀ (leg. A. Gahcis ) ( NMW )
;
Muğla , Marmaris ,
27.8.1969
, 1♂ (leg. S. Karol ) ( AÜZM ); GREECE
:
Greece , Dodecanese, W. side of Kalilimni [ Kalimnos ],
100 m
,
21.7.1950
, 1♀ (leg. P. H. Davis ) (det. as
Orchamus davisi
) ( NHMUK )
.

Remarks. All studied males collected from S.W. Turkey including the paratypes and topotype of
O. davisi
have male genitalia undoubtedly agreeing with
O. yersini
. Thus,
O. davisi
is conspecific of this species, but the external diagnostic characters given by Uvarov (1949: 8) and the distribution localized mainly in S.W. and W. of Anatolia and some Greek islands near to Turkey are enough evidence to consider it as a subspecies of
O. yersini
. Massa (2009) considered the specimens, which have different genitalia from
O. yersini
, as
O. davisi
. Those specimens in fact are an undescribed species (see
O. massai
sp. nov. below).
